bible.notes: Restored Greek syntax. A concordance of every form of every Greek word was made and systematized and turned into English. The whole Greek vocabulary was analyzed and translated, using a standard English equivalent for each Greek element.

translations.name: Concordant Literal Version
translations.description: The Concordant Literal New Testament represents the life’s work of  A. E. Knoch. It is an English translation of the Bible compiled by the Concordant Publishing Concern (CPC). It attempts to put the English reader, who lacks a formal knowledge of Koine Greek, in possession of all the vital information needed to understand the New Testament in the context of its original languages. The first edition of the CLNT came out in 1926.
